#summary Procedure to install Qt for Linux

[http://tonatiuh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/qt/qtLogo.png]

Qt is cross-platform application framework for GUI development. 

= Details =

To install the Qt libraries in your computer download the installer file _qt-x11-opensource-src-4.4.3.tar.gz_ from the Trolltech website at http://www.qtsoftware.com/downloads/linux-x11-cpp to downloads on your home directory, _/home/username/downloads_.

Open a shell console and navigate to desktop. Extract donwloaded file typing:
{{{
tar -xvzf qt-x11-opensource-src-4.4.3.tar.gz
}}}

After extraction, a new directory, qt-x11-opensource-src-4.4.3, will be created. Go to the directory and type:
{{{
./configure
}}}

You will be asked to accept the license agreement. Accept it typing yes. 

After qt configuration is finished, to install qt libraries typing:
{{{
make
make install
}}}

After the release version of the Qt libraries are installed,  we must specify where Qt is installed. Type:
{{{
kwrite ~/.bashrc
}}}

Type the following in the file that will appear:
{{{
QTDIR=/usr/local/Trolltech/Qt-4.4.3
export QTDIR

PATH=$QTDIR/bin:$PATH
export PATH

}}}

Save the changes and close editor.
